newsitem.title: TURKEY: SOCCER-FANS ASKED TO AVOID ROWDY POST-MATCH BEHAVIOUR.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-FANS ASKED TO AVOID ROWDY POST-MATCH BEHAVIOUR.

text.p: Fans of top Turkish clubs Galatasaray and Besiktas have been asked to avoid rowdy post-match behaviour at a crucial derby clash between their teams on Friday night.

Istanbul residents were bracing themeslves for more over-exuberant victory celebrations, as Turkish soccer supporters often fire guns randomly in the air with joy, regularly wounding or injuring people.
Meanwhile, fans of the losing team can take to the streets to vent their anger on opposition supporters.
Consequently, Galatasaray chairman Faruk Suren and Besiktas chairman Suleyman Seba met to have lunch ahead of the match and appealed to their fans to support the teams in a "gentlemanly manner".
"May the best team win," said Suren, as the two men shook hands and exchanged bouquets of flowers.

League leaders Galatasaray's coach Fatih Terim said: "This is a match of three points. But it is all the more important because we are playing our championship rivals -- if we win it will be like gaining six points."
